news_header: At least 40 people were killed in Israeli strikes in eastern Lebanon, targeting Hezbollah operatives, with significant damage to a UNESCO site.
news_text: Israeli airstrikes in eastern Lebanon resulted in at least 40 deaths, targeting Hezbollah operatives in Baalbek and Bekaa. The strikes also caused severe damage to an Ottoman-era building near Roman ruins, a UNESCO World Heritage site. In southern Beirut, Israeli strikes hit command centers and infrastructure, while Hezbollah retaliated with rocket fire, killing an Israeli man. The conflict has escalated, with significant casualties and displacement reported in Lebanon.
